Sequence Information.Source: sequence truncation, reptile cathelicidin analog, animal-derived, natural derivative

Literature Information.Literature: Peptide discovery: a synthetic peptide from the first reported genome predicted cathelicidin.Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence shows similarity (82.76%) toa long form CATHPb4R: 36%, A=G: 12%. The long form is temporarily assigned as "natural".Activity: Active against Gram- E. coli ATCC 25922 or clinical isolate (MIC 3-4.7 ug/ml), P. aeruginosa ATCC 27853 (MIC 8 ug/ml), S. typhimurium ATCC 14028 (MIC 2 ug/ml), K. pneumoniae (MIC 1.18 ug/ml), Gram+ S.aureus ATCC 29213 (MIC >128 ug/ml), B. cereus ATCC 10876 (MIC 32 ug/ml).In vitro toxicity: chicken RBC, 10.7% hemolysis at 64 ug/ml.
Literature Information.Author: Kim D, Soundrarajan N, Lee J, Cho HS, Choi M, Cha SY, Ahn B, Jeon H, Le MT, Song H, Kim JH, Park C.2017
Literature Information.Title: Genomewide Analysis of the Antimicrobial Peptides in Python bivittatus and Characterization of Cathelicidins with Potent Antimicrobial Activity and Low Cytotoxicity.
